ca.mahram.android
Class TouchImageView

java.lang.Object
  ImageView
      ca.mahram.android.TouchImageView

public class TouchImageView
extends ImageView

TouchImageView extends ImageView to include pinch zooming, panning, fling and double tap zoom.

The following properties can be set within the XML declaration to control the behaviour of ToughImageView:
minScale Minimum scale that the image can be down-sized to. This is a float.
maxScale Maximum scale that the image can be down-sized to. This is a float.
minScaleBounceBackMultiplier Multiplied by the minimum scale, this number determines how much smaller than the minimum scale the picture has to be pinched before it bounces back to the minimum. This is a float.
maxScaleBounceBackMultiplier Multiplied by the maximum scale, this number determines how much larger than the maximum scale the picture has to be zoomed before it bounces back to the maximum. This is a float.
allowScale set to true to enable pinch zoom and false to disable. This setting also affects the double tap behaviour.
flingBehaviour determines how the image view reacts to fling events. This is an enum:

  • scroll means that the image will pan in the direction of the fling (if zoomed in)
  • listener allows the user to specify a @{link FlingListener} to be informed of fling events. Panning is still handled, but as a drag event (no inertia).
  • disable ignores all fling events. Panning is handled as a drag event (no inertia).
allowDrag set to true to enable panning while zoomed and false to disable panning.
allowDoubleTap if set to true double tap toggles the zoom state. If set to false double tap events are ignored.
maintainZoom if set to true the newly loaded image will retain the zoom state of the previous image (if any). Setting this to false will reset the zoom state when a new image is loaded.

setFlingListener

public void setFlingListener(TouchImageView.FlingListener listener)
register a @{link FlingListener} instance. Fling behaviour must be set to 'listener'.

Parameters:
listener - listener to register. Provide 'null' to clear current listener.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the behaviour is not set to 'listener'

Parameters:

getCurrentZoom

public float getCurrentZoom()
Get the current zoom. This is the zoom level relative to the initial (fill view) scale, not the original resource.

Returns:
current zoom multiplier.
